channel.title: Book Summaries by Dean Stewart on Shortened Books
channel.description: Recent content in Book Summaries by Dean Stewart on Shortened Books

item.title: Abundance Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Deepak Chopra
item.description: “Abundance: The Inner Path to Wealth” authored by Deepak Chopra, is a thought-provoking and insightful guide that delves into the realm of personal transformation and self-discovery to attain true wealth and abundance.

item.title: 10% Happier Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dan Harris
item.description: “10% Happier: How I Tamed the Voice in My Head, Reduced Stress without Losing My Edge and Found Self-Help That Actually Works” is a captivating memoir by Dan Harris, an accomplished news anchor and journalist.

item.title: On Writing Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Stephen King
item.description: “On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft” is a captivating and instructive book penned by the prolific and renowned author Stephen King.

item.title: Five Major Pieces to the Life Puzzle Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Jim Rohn
item.description: “Five Major Pieces to the Life Puzzle: A Guide to Personal Success” is a self-help book written by Jim Rohn, a renowned motivational speaker and personal development expert.

item.title: Betting on You Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Laurie Ruettimann
item.description: “Betting on You” is a self-help book written by Laurie Ruettimann that aims to empower individuals to take control of their careers and prioritize their own well-being.

item.title: Grain Brain Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dr. David Perlmutter
item.description: “Grain Brain: The Surprising Truth about Wheat, Carbs, and Sugarâ€”Your Brain’s Silent Killers” by David Perlmutter is a groundbreaking book that explores the connection between nutrition, brain health, and overall well-being.

item.title: Go Wild Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dr. John Ratey and Richard Manning
item.description: “Go Wild: Eat Fat, Run Free, Be Social, and Follow Evolution’s Other Rules for Total Health and Well-Being” is an intriguing book written by John Ratey, a renowned psychiatrist, and Richard Manning, an environmental author.

item.title: The Achievement Habit Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Bernard Roth
item.description: “The Achievement Habit: Stop Wishing, Start Doing, and Take Command of Your Life” is a self-help book written by Bernard Roth, a professor of engineering and the co-founder of the Stanford d.

item.title: The Paleo Manifesto Summary of Key Ideas and Review - John Durant
item.description: “The Paleo Manifesto: Ancient Wisdom for Lifelong Health” is a book written by John Durant that explores the concept of paleo living, drawing inspiration from our ancestors’ lifestyles and applying it to modern-day health and wellness.

item.title: Show Your Work! Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Austin Kleon
item.description: “Show Your Work!” by Austin Kleon is a creative guidebook that encourages individuals to embrace their creativity and share it with the world.

item.title: The Hoops Whisperer Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Idan Ravin
item.description: “The Hoops Whisperer: On the Court and Inside the Heads of Basketball’s Best Players” is a book written by Idan Ravin, a renowned basketball trainer who has worked with some of the NBA’s biggest stars.

item.title: The Little Book of Talent Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Daniel Coyle
item.description: “The Little Book of Talent: 52 Tips for Improving Your Skills” by Daniel Coyle is a practical guide to developing and honing your skills in any field.

item.title: The Marshmallow Test Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Walter Mischel
item.description: “The Marshmallow Test: Why Self-Control Is the Engine of Success” by Walter Mischel explores the fascinating research conducted by the author and his colleagues, focusing on the concept of self-control and its impact on success in various aspects of life.

item.title: How Successful People Think Summary of Key Ideas and Review - John Maxwell
item.description: “How Successful People Think” is a self-help book written by John C.

item.title: Art & Fear Summary of Key Ideas and Review - David Bayles and Ted Orland
item.description: “Art & Fear: Observations On the Perils (and Rewards) of Artmaking” is a book written by David Bayles and Ted Orland.

item.title: Little Bets Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Peter Sims
item.description: “Little Bets: How Breakthrough Ideas Emerge from Small Discoveries” by Peter Sims explores the concept of using a series of small experiments, or “little bets,” to foster creativity, innovation, and the development of breakthrough ideas.

item.title: The Art of Work Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Jeff Goins
item.description: “The Art of Work: A Proven Path to Discovering What You Were Meant to Do” by Jeff Goins is a self-help book that explores the journey of finding one’s true calling in life.

item.title: The Happiness Equation Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Neil Pasricha
item.description: “The Happiness Equation: Want Nothing + Do Anything = Have Everything” by Neil Pasricha is a self-help book that explores the concept of happiness and provides practical strategies to achieve a more fulfilling life.

item.title: Off Balance Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Matthew Kelly
item.description: “Off Balance” is a self-help book written by Matthew Kelly that challenges the conventional notion of work-life balance and offers a fresh perspective on achieving personal and professional satisfaction.

item.title: Take Your Time Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Eknath Easwaran
item.description: “Take Your Time: The Wisdom of Slowing Down” is a thought-provoking book written by Eknath Easwaran, a renowned spiritual teacher and author.

item.title: Golf is Not a Game of Perfect Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dr. Bob Rotella
item.description: “Golf is Not a Game of Perfect” by Bob Rotella is a highly acclaimed self-help book that explores the mental side of golf and provides valuable insights and strategies to improve performance on the golf course.

item.title: Drive Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Daniel Pink
item.description: “Drive: The Surprising Truth About What Motivates Us” by Daniel Pink explores the factors that truly motivate individuals in their personal and professional lives.

item.title: Unleash the Warrior Within Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Richard Mack Machowicz
item.description: “Unleash the Warrior Within: Develop the Focus, Discipline, Confidence, and Courage You Need to Achieve Unlimited Goals” is a self-help book written by Richard Mack Machowicz, a former Navy SEAL and a renowned motivational speaker.

item.title: Noble Purpose Summary of Key Ideas and Review - William Damon
item.description: “Noble Purpose: The Joy of Living a Meaningful Life” is a book written by William Damon, a renowned psychologist and professor at Stanford University.

item.title: Mind Hacking Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Sir John Hargrave
item.description: “Mind Hacking: How to Change Your Mind for Good in 21 Days” is a self-help book written by Sir John Hargrave.

item.title: You Learn by Living Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: “You Learn by Living: Eleven Keys for a More Fulfilling Life” is a book written by Eleanor Roosevelt, the former First Lady of the United States.

item.title: How We Learn Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Benedict Carey
item.description: “How We Learn: The Surprising Truth About When, Where, and Why It Happens” by Benedict Carey is an interesting exploration of the human learning process and the strategies that can optimize learning and memory retention.

item.title: Always Hungry? Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dr. David Ludwig
item.description: “Always Hungry?: Conquer Cravings, Retrain Your Fat Cells, and Lose Weight Permanently” is a book written by David Ludwig, a renowned physician and researcher in the field of nutrition and obesity.

item.title: In Defense of Food Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Michael Pollan
item.description: “In Defense of Food: An Eater’s Manifesto” by Michael Pollan is a thought-provoking book that explores the complex and often confusing world of nutrition and offers practical advice on how to make healthier food choices.

item.title: Thoughts of a Philosophical Fighter Pilot Summary of Key Ideas and Review - James Stockdale
item.description: “Thoughts of a Philosophical Fighter Pilot” is a thought-provoking book written by James Stockdale, a former United States Navy Vice Admiral and Vietnam War veteran.

item.title: Fully Engaged Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Thomas Sterner
item.description: “Fully Engaged: Using the Practicing Mind in Daily Life” is a self-help book written by Thomas Sterner.

item.title: Anxiety Free Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Patrick McKeown
item.description: “Anxiety Free: Stop Worrying and Quieten Your Mind” by Patrick McKeown is a self-help book that offers practical strategies and techniques to overcome anxiety and quiet the mind.

item.title: The Power of Starting Something Stupid Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Richie Norton and Natalie Norton
item.description: “The Power of Starting Something Stupid: How to Crush Fear, Make Dreams Happen, and Live without Regret” by Richie Norton and Natalie Norton is a motivational and practical guide that encourages readers to overcome fear and take action to pursue their dreams.

item.title: Knowledge of the Higher Worlds and its Attainment Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Rudolf Steiner
item.description: “Knowledge of the Higher Worlds and Its Attainment” is a philosophical and spiritual work written by Rudolf Steiner, the founder of Anthroposophy.

item.title: Getting Grit Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Caroline Miller
item.description: “Getting Grit: The Evidence-Based Approach to Cultivating Passion, Perseverance, and Purpose” by Caroline Miller is a self-help book that explores the concept of grit and provides evidence-based strategies for developing and enhancing one’s “grittiness.

item.title: Messy Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Tim Harford
item.description: “Messy: The Power of Disorder to Transform Our Lives” by Tim Harford is a stimulating exploration of the benefits of embracing disorder and randomness in our lives.

item.title: Designed to Move Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dr. Joan Vernikos
item.description: “Designed to Move: The Science-Backed Program to Fight Sitting Disease and Enjoy Lifelong Health” by Joan Vernikos is a groundbreaking book that explores the detrimental effects of a sedentary lifestyle and provides a science-backed program to counteract the negative impact of sitting.

item.title: The Telomere Effect Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dr. Elizabeth Blackburn and Elissa Epel
item.description: “The Telomere Effect: A Revolutionary Approach to Living Younger, Healthier, Longer” is a groundbreaking book written by Elizabeth Blackburn, a Nobel Prize-winning scientist, and Elissa Epel, a health psychologist.

item.title: Discover the Power Within You Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Eric Butterworth
item.description: “Discover the Power Within You: A Guide to the Unexplored Depths Within” by Eric Butterworth is a transformative book that delves into the realm of spirituality and personal growth.

item.title: When Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Daniel Pink
item.description: “When: The Scientific Secrets of Perfect Timing” by Daniel Pink is a captivating exploration of the role that timing plays in our lives, both personally and professionally.

item.title: An Audience of One Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Srinivas Rao
item.description: “An Audience of One: Reclaiming Creativity for Its Own Sake” by Srinivas Rao is a thought-provoking book that challenges the conventional notions of creativity and encourages readers to embrace their creative instincts for personal fulfillment rather than external validation.

item.title: Rest Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Alex Soojung-Kim Pang
item.description: “Rest: Why You Get More Done When You Work Less” by Alex Soojung-Kim Pang is an interesting book that challenges the conventional notion that working longer hours leads to greater productivity.

item.title: Elite Minds Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Stan Beecham
item.description: “Elite Minds: How Winners Think Differently to Create a Competitive Edge and Maximize Success” by Stan Beecham is a book that explores the mindset and thinking patterns of high achievers and provides insights into how they approach challenges and maximize their potential for success.

item.title: How Bad Do You Want It? Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Matt Fitzgerald
item.description: “How Bad Do You Want It?: Mastering the Psychology of Mind Over Muscle” by Matt Fitzgerald is a captivating exploration of the role of mental strength in athletic performance.

item.title: This Book Will Make You Dangerous Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Tripp Lanier
item.description: “This Book Will Make You Dangerous: The Irreverent Guide for Men Who Refuse to Settle” is a self-help book written by Tripp Lanier.

item.title: How to Be Free Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Epictetus and Anthony Long
item.description: “How to Be Free: An Ancient Guide to the Stoic Life” is a book that explores the teachings of the Stoic philosopher Epictetus, as compiled by his student Arrian.

item.title: The Stress Test Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Ian Robertson
item.description: “The Stress Test: How Pressure Can Make You Stronger and Sharper” by Ian Robertson explores the concept of stress and its impact on human performance.

item.title: Make Your Bed Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Admiral William McRaven
item.description: “Make Your Bed” is a motivational book written by Admiral William H.

item.title: The Freak Factor Summary of Key Ideas and Review - David Rendall
item.description: “The Freak Factor: Discovering Uniqueness by Flaunting Weakness” by David Rendall is a book that challenges conventional wisdom by encouraging individuals to embrace their weaknesses and use them as strengths.

item.title: The Seven Principles for Making Marriage Work Summary of Key Ideas and Review - John Gottman and Nan Silver
item.description: “The Seven Principles for Making Marriage Work: A Practical Guide from the Country’s Foremost Relationship Expert” is a book written by renowned psychologist and relationship expert John Gottman, along with Nan Silver.

item.title: How to Stop Worrying and Start Living Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dale Carnegie
item.description: “How to Stop Worrying and Start Living” is a self-help book written by Dale Carnegie, the acclaimed author of “How to Win Friends and Influence People.

item.title: Be Unstoppable Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Alden Mills
item.description: “Be Unstoppable: The 8 Essential Actions to Succeed at Anything” is a self-help book written by Alden Mills, a former Navy SEAL and successful entrepreneur.

item.title: Why Meditate Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Matthieu Ricard
item.description: “Why Meditate: Working with Thoughts and Emotions” is a book written by Matthieu Ricard, a French Buddhist monk, author, and translator.

item.title: Go Long! Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Jerry Rice and Brian Curtis
item.description: “Go Long!: My Journey Beyond the Game and the Fame” is a memoir written by Jerry Rice, widely considered one of the greatest wide receivers in the history of the National Football League (NFL).

item.title: Conquest of Mind Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Eknath Easwaran
item.description: “Conquest of Mind: Take Charge of Your Thoughts and Reshape Your Life Through Meditation” is a transformative book written by Eknath Easwaran.

item.title: Eat That Frog! Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Brian Tracy
item.description: “Eat That Frog!: 21 Great Ways to Stop Procrastinating and Get More Done in Less Time” by Brian Tracy is a self-help book that provides practical strategies for overcoming procrastination and increasing productivity.

item.title: The Gifts of Imperfection Summary of Key Ideas and Review - BrenÃ© Brown
item.description: “The Gifts of Imperfection” is a self-help book written by BrenÃ© Brown, a research professor at the University of Houston.

item.title: You Are the Placebo Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dr. Joe Dispenza
item.description: “You Are the Placebo: Making Your Mind Matter” by Joe Dispenza is a transformative book that explores the power of the mind in healing and personal transformation.

item.title: Constructive Living Summary of Key Ideas and Review - David Reynolds
item.description: “Constructive Living” is a self-help book written by David K. Reynolds, blending elements from Western psychotherapy and Eastern philosophical traditions.

item.title: Emotional Intelligence Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Daniel Goleman
item.description: “Emotional Intelligence: Why It Can Matter More Than IQ” by Daniel Goleman explores the concept of emotional intelligence and its significance for personal and professional success.

item.title: 1:59 Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Philip Maffetone
item.description: “1:59: The Sub-Two-Hour Marathon Is Within Reachâ€”Here’s How It Will Go Down, and What It Can Teach All Runners About Training and Racing” is a book written by Philip Maffetone, a renowned endurance coach and author.

item.title: How to Become a Straight-A Student Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Cal Newport
item.description: “How to Become a Straight-A Student: The Unconventional Strategies Real College Students Use to Score High While Studying Less” is a book written by Cal Newport, a renowned author and professor of computer science at Georgetown University.

item.title: The Obstacle Is the Way Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Ryan Holiday
item.description: “The Obstacle Is the Way: The Timeless Art of Turning Trials into Triumph” is an intellectually challenging and inspiring self-help book written by Ryan Holiday.

item.title: Move Your DNA Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Katy Bowman
item.description: “Move Your DNA: Restore Your Health Through Natural Movement” is a book written by Katy Bowman, a biomechanist and movement educator.

item.title: The Second Mountain Summary of Key Ideas and Review - David Brooks
item.description: “The Second Mountain: The Quest for a Moral Life” is a thought-provoking book written by David Brooks, an American journalist, commentator, and author.

item.title: The Book of Understanding Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Osho
item.description: “The Book of Understanding: Creating Your Own Path to Freedom” is a spiritual guide written by Osho, an Indian mystic and philosopher.

item.title: How to Win Friends and Influence People Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dale Carnegie
item.description: “How to Win Friends and Influence People” is a self-help book written by Dale Carnegie and first published in 1936.

item.title: The Philosophy of Cognitive-Behavioural Therapy (CBT) Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Donald Robertson
item.description: “The Philosophy of Cognitive-Behavioural Therapy (CBT): Stoic Philosophy as Rational and Cognitive Psychotherapy” by Donald Robertson is a comprehensive exploration of the philosophical underpinnings of cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT).

item.title: The Courage Quotient Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Robert Biswas-Diener
item.description: “The Courage Quotient: How Science Can Make You Braver” by Robert Biswas-Diener is a captivating exploration of courage, delving into the science behind this essential human trait.

item.title: Spiritual Economics Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Eric Butterworth
item.description: “Spiritual Economics: The Principles and Process of True Prosperity” by Eric Butterworth is a transformative book that explores the connection between spirituality and prosperity.

item.title: Mindset Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Carol Dweck
item.description: “Mindset: The New Psychology of Success” by Carol Dweck is a groundbreaking book that explores the concept of mindset and its impact on personal and professional success.

item.title: Chasing Excellence Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Ben Bergeron
item.description: “Chasing Excellence: A Story About Building the World’s Fittest Athletes” by Ben Bergeron is a compelling book that delves into the world of competitive CrossFit and provides insights on building a mindset of excellence.

item.title: Daring Greatly Summary of Key Ideas and Review - BrenÃ© Brown
item.description: “Daring Greatly: How the Courage to Be Vulnerable Transforms the Way We Live, Love, Parent, and Lead” is a transformative book written by BrenÃ© Brown.

item.title: Win Forever Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Pete Carroll, Yogi Roth and Kristoffer Garin
item.description: “Win Forever: Live, Work, and Play Like a Champion” is a motivational and self-help book written by Pete Carroll, Yogi Roth, and Kristoffer Garin.

item.title: How Champions Think Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Bob Rotella
item.description: “How Champions Think: In Sports and in Life” is a book written by renowned sports psychologist Dr.

item.title: Superhuman by Habit Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Tynan
item.description: “Superhuman by Habit: A Guide to Becoming the Best Possible Version of Yourself, One Tiny Habit at a Time” is a self-help book written by Tynan, an influential blogger and author in the personal development space.

item.title: Ego Is the Enemy Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Ryan Holiday
item.description: “Ego Is the Enemy” is an intellectually challenging book written by Ryan Holiday, an author known for his insightful works on Stoicism.

item.title: Finding Your Zone Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Michael Lardon
item.description: “Finding Your Zone: Ten Core Lessons for Achieving Peak Performance in Sports and Life” by Michael Lardon is a book that explores the principles and strategies behind achieving peak performance in sports and various aspects of life.

item.title: Everything is Figureoutable Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Marie Forleo
item.description: “Everything is Figureoutable” is a self-help book written by Marie Forleo, a renowned entrepreneur, writer, and motivational speaker.

item.title: Future Visions Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Dr. Edward Hoffman and Abraham Maslow
item.description: “Future Visions: The Unpublished Papers of Abraham Maslow” is a captivating book written by Dr.

item.title: Crushing It! Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Gary Vaynerchuk
item.description: “Crushing It!: How Great Entrepreneurs Build Their Business and Influence-and How You Can, Too” is a bestselling self-help book written by entrepreneur and social media expert Gary Vaynerchuk.

item.title: Peak Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Anders Ericsson and Robert Pool
item.description: “Peak: Secrets from the New Science of Expertise” is a book written by Anders Ericsson and Robert Pool, published in 2016.

item.title: The Dhammapada Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Eknath Easwaran
item.description: “The Dhammapada” is a collection of sayings of the Buddha in verse form.

item.title: Principles: Life and Work Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Ray Dalio
item.description: “Principles: Life and Work” is a book written by Ray Dalio, who is the founder of the investment firm Bridgewater Associates.

item.title: Happy Together Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Suzann Pawelski and James O. Pawelski
item.description: “Happy Together: Using the Science of Positive Psychology to Build Love That Lasts” by Suzann Pileggi Pawelski and James O.

item.title: Stillness Is the Key Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Ryan Holiday
item.description: “Stillness Is the Key” is a self-help book written by Ryan Holiday that explores the power of stillness and mindfulness in modern life.

item.title: Flourish Summary of Key Ideas and Review - Martin Seligman
item.description: “Flourish: A Visionary New Understanding of Happiness and Well-being” is a book written by Martin Seligman, a psychologist and researcher who is known for his work on the topic of positive psychology.
